content.description:
P1 110', 5.8, a little ro to b1 8m u

P2 60', 5.9, beautifully bolted through the crux.


Bolts

Start in a small right facing corner and follow the line of bolts. One can continue using the corner, but keeping it left and closer to arete will make the climbing more interesting and closer to the grade.

Third route from the left. Start is just right of a gully.  The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante has an excellent photo that helps identifying the routes at Morro Bluffs.
9 bolts

climbs.name: A View From the Hoof Tops

content.description:
Climb past 3 bolts to get to a dirt ledge where the climbing improves through overlaps past 6 closely spaced bolts.



Left of The Treadmill by about 10m. The 1st bolted lines you come to hiking in.

9 bolts to anchor with rings.

P1: 5.7, 23m, 7 bolts

P2: 5.8, 20m, 8 bolts

Can link with 15 draws and a 60m. Good beginner multi and spectacular views. Very well bolted. Multiple options for second pitch. Teacher Convention, 5.9 on far left and Mineral Bath, 5.9 far right. Original 5.8 pitch in the middle.



Furthest right line at crag.

Bolted and rap rings for descent

Tricky opening move is followed by even more interesting smearing on an almost blank wall. Somehow the feet will hold through a couple of technical crux moves that lead to an easier but still sustained and enjoyable climbing.

Right route on a small slab tower that share the anchor with Pikas in the Hood. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante has an excellent photo that helps identifying the routes at Morro Bluffs.
7 bolts

The difficulty will gradually increase from an easy corner to a small bulge to fun smearing at the end of climb. Short, but enjoyable climbing.

Left route on a small slab tower that share the anchor with Friction Addiction. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante has an excellent photo that helps identifying the routes at Morro Bluffs.
7 bolts

Alternative second pitch to Arco Boleino. Beta is apparently to climb the arete to the right. Climbing the face feels 5.10- if you happen to be craving something 5.10 and find yourself at this crag where the highest grade is 5.9. Extremely well bolted (about 4 bolts in as many meters) so may as well try it since any falls would be fairly chill. 



Climb first pitch of Arco Boleino. This will be the furthest line on the left afterwards on the steep, blank face.

8 bolts

Excellent climbing with two cruxes. Avoid going in the broken corner system to the right of bolts. Doing so will decrease the grade to 5.4-5.5 and you will miss the fun smearing sections and the thin moves of the first crux that comes about 2/3 up the climb. Either way will end with a steeper section of the second crux shortly before the bolted anchors.

Second route from the left. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante has an excellent photo that helps identifying the routes at Morro Bluffs.
14 bolts

Enjoyable climbing on interesting limestone slabs. The routes are tightly bolted and appropriately graded 5.7 to 5.9. The Northern Exposure guidebook by Francois Laplante describes Morro Bluffs as a popular area to learn how to lead.
